titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds (first, last) in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 Jan. 5

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds (first, last) in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 Jan. 5

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Just to tell you I am still living and having a dandy time. This is Sunday Night and has been a wonderful day I have been walking around the city most all day there are lots of pretty places to go around here I am going out for a trip tomorrow will start a six a. m. and retrun about 5 pm The weather is real warm here someting Florida or Cal. Beasutiful palm trees.

I am at the Y. M. C. A. now it is at teh beach building sets out in the warter about two hundred feet. I will say it is some beauty in an old club house I think this place is a winter resort resort in France. I have a nice palace to stay at and Uncle Sam pays the bill. Pretty nice of the old boy I will be here for seven days and believe since I will hate for the last day to come around when I will have to leave for the land of rain and mud. You remember I told you what I would do for the man that called this sunny France. Well I have found out where he was (he was in nice) Marsilles is a pretty city also I was there three days.

We have a dance here at Y. M. C. A. every night except Sunday There is good many Red Cross Nurses here on leave also so we have a real time. Makes a fellow feel like he is human any way. I have been in most all the lager cities in France in the last ten days.
I may send you some post cards I have for souviners you can keep them for me until I get home. I dont know yet whether they will let me or not.

Well I must try to tell you all about this they would take to much paper and we have much to write I hope you had a good time x mas. I had a good diner X mas day and then left out on 27 for may try . expect to get back about 15 Jan will write you agin in few days and tell you little more. So good night and lots of love from
